text:
Hello everybody,
We got the beta ungated for our dev portal and are very excited to try it out :fire:
One thing we noticed is that theme modules are not listed in the page editor anymore. This also applies to HubSpot’s themes, e.g. the Growth theme, see <https://take.ms/rFzEAi>.
After deactivating the beta on that portal the modules were showing again.
Those themes do use non-React modules, but maybe it is related to the beta.
Does anybody else experience this?
Have a nice weekend :otter::v:
Thanks for letting us know. We’ll dive into it… and sorry for the trouble!

No problem and thank you Timothy :pray:
The portal is also showing a red notification now stating that various tools are not loading for some users, see <https://take.ms/bTe4L>
But the modules are back. So not sure if it is a general issue or related to the beta.
We do not see that particular behaviour on other portals.

I actually put in a support ticket for that exact issue (portal acting like theme modules don't exist) last week. Not sure it's related to the beta though as it only started happening last week and we've had the beta active longer than that. Last I heard from support is "My team mentioned they see where the issue is It appears that the `limit` query param isn't working as one might expect. They plan on having a fix ungated over the next few days.".
I’m pretty confident it is a bug that only shows up for accounts with our beta enabled (and it was recently introduced in the past ~week)

Oooh if it's related to the beta can we actually get the beta disabled in our main portal then? We've only been using the beta in our dev portals and this bug has really put us behind on a redesign we're in the middle of.

Thank you for your report Alyssa and happy that we were able to narrow it down.
Every known bug is a good one. Hopefully, there is an easy fix around the corner.
